Dozens of legal challenges over Elon Musk's powerful role in the Trump administration will press ahead . Musk announced his departure earlier this week . At least three lawsuits are pending that accuse Trump of unconstitutionally handing Musk the equivalent of a cabinet-level post .  The larger collection of lawsuits challenging Musk and DOGE activities to date are certain to continue . They include fights over access to Americans’ personal information, whether the office is subject to public records laws . The White House has declined to comment on the administration's next steps in court .  Some legal experts say Musk’s formal exit could give the Justice Department grounds to argue for dismissal . A Justice Department spokesperson and Musk did not respond to requests for comment .  “Musk was a minion. responsible for communicating Trump’s “will” to Senate-confirmed officials who carried out the actions . “The lawsuits may have other things, they may challenge the substantive validity of the reduction of force or cancellation of contracts, but that had nothing to do with Musk”  A Washington federal judge this week denied the government’s request to dismiss the states’ case over Musk's appointment . Musk joined the administration as a “special government employee,” a temporary status set to expire this month .  Dozens more lawsuits have been filed that relate to DOGE’s activities . Judges have handed down a mix of rulings, in some cases greenlighting DOGEs’ access to agency records and allowing cuts to federal spending and the workforce . “While he may have left Washington, the havoc he has created has not,” a group says . Elon Musk has a long history of overpromising and underdelivering . Musk's exit from DOGE seems like it’s meant to signal another big promise, one loaded with similarly inflated expectations . Tesla's shares are down 25% from a December high .  Whether he is actually leaving his position remains in dispute, but Musk’s tenure in Washington, D.C., was turbulent by any measure . Musk seemed to furtherenrich himselfandthwart his competitors through government channels .  Tesla CEO Elon Musk announced he is leaving the White House this week . His exit comes after a series of public clashes with President Donald Trump's policies .  At some point after the White House’s bizarreToyotathon for Tesla event, Musk seemed to stop spreading the conspiracy theory that paid protesters were fueling the Tesla Takedown . It's an indication Musk either recognizes that the backlash is legitimate, or, more likely, that his defensive denials of its authenticity were doing him no favors .  Tesla still has other challenges ahead, analyst says . The kind of reputational damage Musk has sustained in 2025 is not the kind that is easily laundered or naturally fades .  Musk may hope to revitalize his reputation in much the same way Trump has done since January 6, 2021, but he is ill-equipped for the task . Trump’s supporters are singularly willing to forgive and forget . Musk is about to find out how little overlap there is with Trump .  The electric car-buying community is the world's biggest electric car fan base . He says he has a lot of fans of the electric car and MAGA fans .

The reconciliation bill working its way through Congress would eliminate the electric vehicle tax credit created under the Inflation Reduction Act . The removal of the credit would likely lead to a drop in EV sales and production . The One Big Beautiful Bill Act was approved by the House on May 22 in a 215-214 vote .  The EV tax credit, which started during the Obama administration, is set to expire on Dec. 31, 2032 . The new provision "accelerates the expiration to December 31, 2025" Ending the clean vehicle tax credit would result in a sharp decrease in EV sales . VistaShares filed this week for a suite of ETFs designed to replicate the holdings of famed money managers like Bill Ackman, Stanley Druckenmiller and Michael Burry . VistaShares plans to launch funds tracking portfolios of Ackman’s portfolios .  The VistaShares Pershing Square Select ETF would be composed of up to 20 stocks reflecting the publicly disclosed holdings of Ackman's firm . The other funds — seven in total, including two based on Druckenmiller’s Duquesne family office and a Berkshire one — would employ similar strategies .  The strategy fits into a push to democratize institutional-style investing in a low-cost wrapper . VistaShares already runs the VistaShares Target 15 Berkshire Select Income ETF (ticker OMAH) The issuer may be looking to replicate the success it’s seen with that vehicle .  VistaShares runs three ETFs altogether, including OMAH . Its co-founder, Jon McNeill, previously served as president at Tesla, and also held a stint at Lyft .  Tracking 13F filings because they offer a rare glimpse into the portfolios of top fund managers,” said Bloomberg Intelligence’s Athanasios Psarofagis . Traditionally, this hedge-fund category has been tough to crack in the ETF wrapper .

Tesla's electric vehicle sales are plummeting, and continued weakness could lead to massive losses for the stock . CEO Elon Musk believes self-driving cars and humanoid robots will eventually make Tesla the world's most valuable company one day . Today, those five companies areMicrosoft,Apple,Nvidia,Amazon, and Alphabet, and they have a combined market capitalization of $13.6 trillion .  Tesla is seeing plummeting demand for electric vehicles . Most of its revenue still comes from selling electric vehicles (EVs) Tesla can't grow production 50% per year if sales aren't keeping up . Deliveries plunged even further in the first quarter of 2025 .  Analyst estimates indicate Tesla might deliver as little as 350,000 cars during the second quarter, or a year-over-year drop of more than 20% . EV sales overall soared 28% across Europe in April . Chinese automakerBYDsaw 359% increase in sales across the region .  Last October, Tesla unveiled its long-awaited Cybercab robotaxi . It has no pedals or steering wheel because it's designed to run entirely on the company's Full Self-Driving (FSD) software . The unsupervised version of Tesla's FSD isn't approved for use on public roads yet .  Tesla CEO Musk says the company could generate $10 trillion in revenue over the long term . The company could be producing millions of robots annually by 2029 or 2030 . The Optimus robot could be used for dangerous jobs and repetitive tasks that humans don't want to do .  Tesla's stock is trading at an eyewatering price-to-earnings (P/E) ratio of 186.5 . Nvidia, Microsoft, Amazon, Apple, and Alphabet trade at an average P/E ratio of just 32.2: Tesla's earnings per share (EPS)plunged 71% during the first quarter of 2025 .  Tesla is destined for a sharp decline instead, bringing its P/E ratio in line with those of its big-tech peers . As a result, there is little hope the company will grow to exceed the combined value of Nvidia, Microsoft, Amazon, Apple and Alphabet anytime soon . Elon Musk is leaving DOGE, the volunteer commission that essentially shuttered the US Agency for International Development . Musk's hubris punctured and his visions of a lean government evaporating .  The chainsaw bravado is gone, with Musk now saying with what sounds like regret that hegot too deeply involved in politics . Trump was happy to let Musk attack the bureaucracy, which fit with his conspiracy theory of a “deep state” that ought to be dismantled . But Trump was never going to do the heavy lifting required to wrangle legislation that would be necessary to downsize the government for real .  DOGE has no legal authority to cut federal spending, close federal agencies, cancel federal contracts . Most spending or spending cuts require congressional legislation . Most moves to create or eliminate government agencies require congressional approval .  DOGE's original goal was $2 trillion in annual savings, downsized several times to $500 billion . The House of Representatives recently passed a bill that would formalize just $9.3 billion in cuts . Critics say the bill is a sham cost-cutting effort that leaves the worst aspects of the federal budgeting process unmolested .  The Trump budget and tax bill will make modest cuts, but impose nothing like the fiscal discipline Musk seeks . Unfinanced tax cuts will likely add $3 trillion to $4 trillion to the national debt, at a time when markets are beginning to groan under unprecedented levels of American debt .  The huge federal bureaucracy is especially resistant to the kind of emergency surgery Musk and others have managed to perform at privately owned companies . Musk, to his credit, succeeds where other people fail . Musk says the spirit of DOGE will live on in the Trump administration because “DOGE is a way of life”  Trump only wanted DOGE as long as Musk was willing to be the sponge . Musk got tired of that, and if Musk can't do it, nobody else can .

The letter said that Musk's outside endeavors appear to have diverted his time and attention from actively managing Tesla's operations .  Tesla also requested that Tesla adopt and disclose a CEO succession plan as well as appoint "at least one new truly independent director with no personal ties to other Board members"
